No they won't, and I'm not sure on the second one, although that could happen with just regular Interstellar as well, so it's probably fine.

Fantastic. I really missed plastering giant Canadian flags all over everything lol. Now that this has been revived, what are the chances that you can whip up a Kerbalized Federation flag.

It looks great!

I'm really excited about your flag parts.

Sorry if you already answered this, but will the flags have individual visuals, or are they bound to the mission flag?

They are bound to the mission flag, although by removing a module from the cfg you could stop it.

Fantastic. I really missed plastering giant Canadian flags all over everything lol. Now that this has been revived, what are the chances that you can whip up a Kerbalized Federation flag.

That shouldn't be too hard, although I believe stuff like that already exists. I'll probably do some for the pack and include them next time I update it, but I'll post them in an imgur album before then.

Edit: Here's some I put together. I made them transparent so they look good just by themselves on ships. Some are better than others. If I missed any big ones let me know. Here's a download for lazy people.

the merchant fleet - mostly seen in memory-beta creations - might be missing..

Edited July 28, 2014 by philotical
trying to add lights to the DS9 can u give me a quick step by step for unity, its not working,??

trying to add lights to the DS9 can u give me a quick step by step for unity, its not working,??

Here's how I do it:

Before you even open Unity, you have to create an emmisive texture. You do this by opening up the standard texture, then colouring white wherever the windows are, then make everything else black (you should use layers). Here's the textures for the Enterprise hull for example. The white areas are what Unity lights up the most, and black the least.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

After this is done go into Unity and select your mesh, choose the KSP/Emmisive/Diffuse shader. Put your regular texture in the top spot and your emmisive in the bottom. Then Follow this tutorial because I'm bad at them.

After you've finished that, you'll want to use this module instead of the engineheat one (for obvious reasons). Rename LightAnimation to whatever you named your animation in Unity. After this it should work.

MODULE
{
	name = ModuleLight
        lightName = spotlight
	useAnimationDim = true
	lightBrightenSpeed = 2.5
	lightDimSpeed = 2.5
	resourceAmount = 0.04
	animationName = LightAnimation
	useResources = true
}

My apologies for the rather poor half tutorial, but I'm not the best at them.

I've got quite a lot of modeling done, including the Flying Saucer internal. It's supposed to be inside the dome, and when I'm finished it will pulsate as well. Here's what it looks like right now:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I've also been working on stuff I haven't talked about before, but I'll save that for another time.

Just wonder about one thing:

there is sounds there:

SciFi\_Enterprise\Parts\Enterprise\part\Sounds

and another sounds dir (the main one I guess) there:

SciFi\_Enterprise\Sounds

Any particular reason for that ?

Just wonder about one thing:

there is sounds there:

SciFi\_Enterprise\Parts\Enterprise\part\Sounds

and another sounds dir (the main one I guess) there:

SciFi\_Enterprise\Sounds

Any particular reason for that ?

There is a reason. The sounds inside the part folders are played using the stock method for custom sounds, while the other sound folders are for the Firespitter engine sounds module. This allows the background noises plus sounds when you throttle up.

Also as I might have mentioned earlier, the old Firespitter module I was using is broken in 0.24.2, so I'll need to update it or just use the main dll for ambient sounds to work again.

Not sure if anyone else is experiencing this, but when I try to IVA, all the textures are black.

I'm not sure if it's the new RasterProp or the fact that I'm using Active Texture Management (x86).

I'm not sure if it's the new RasterProp or the fact that I'm using Active Texture Management (x86).

although the warp trail is just a line renderer and not even a texture..
